Class BoardFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window

            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.BoardFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class BoardFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Graphical frame of for interactive editing of a routing board.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardFrame

        public BoardFrame(DesignFile p_design,
                  BoardFrame.Option p_option,
                  TestLevel p_test_level,
                  java.util.Locale p_locale,
                  boolean p_confirm_cancel)
        Creates new form BoardFrame. If p_option = FROM_START_MENU this frame is created from a start menu frame. If p_option = SINGLE_FRAME, this frame is created directly a single frame. If p_option = Option.IN_SAND_BOX, no security sensitive actions like for example choosing If p_option = Option.WEBSTART, the application has been started with Java Webstart. files are allowed, so that the frame can be used in an applet. Currently Option.EXTENDED_TOOL_BAR is used only if a new board is created by the application from scratch. If p_test_level > RELEASE_VERSION, functionality not yet ready for release is included. Also the warning output depends on p_test_level.
        Parameters:
        p_design - a DesignFile object.
        p_option - a BoardFrame.Option object.
        p_test_level - a TestLevel object.
        p_locale - a Locale object.
        p_confirm_cancel - a boolean.
